title: Proscribes conduct by a custodian wherein he or she threatens to injure or injures a member of a child's family
summary: Proscribes conduct by a custodian of a child wherein he or she threatens to injure or injures a member of a child's family.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2254

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the penal law,
in relation to endangering the welfare of a child

PURPOSE OF THE BILL:
This bill would proscribe conduct by a parent or
custodian which threatens to injure a member of a child's family.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
The bill amends section 260.10 of the
penal law "endangering the welfare of a child" by adding a
new subdivision 1-a to provide that where a parent or guardian
attempts to injure, threaten to injure, knowingly injures or engaged
in conduct likely to injure a member of the child's family or
household, that person can be charged with and may be found guilty of
endangering the welfare of a child--a class A misdemeanor.

JUSTIFICATION:
Under current law a charge of Endangering the Welfare
of a Child is sufficient if based upon the existence of domestic
violence in the home. This amendment would further hold domestic
violence offenders criminally accountable for their actions which
impact on children. Studies have shown that violence in the home
detrimentally impacts on a child's psychological, physical and
emotional development. The proposal would add to the sanctions
available against the offender. More importantly, it would also add
to the protection afforded children exposed to domestic violence,
particularly in cases where it is not possible to proceed with a
prosecution on the underlying acts of domestic violence. Domestic
violence victim advocates and other professionals are proponents of
this proposal.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
